text: Joseph Gledhill (November 17, 1837 - March 20, 1906) was a British astronomer. He worked as an assistant at the Bermerside Observatory in Halifax, West Yorkshire, England. In 1879 he co-authored the book A Handbook of Double Stars with Edward Crossley and Rev. James Wilson (who was later Canon of Worcester). A crater on Mars is named in his honour. ==Obituary== * MNRAS 67 (1907) 232 Category:1837 births Category:1906 deaths Category:British astronomers
title: Joseph Gledhill
